excerpt: Small museum of paintings from the 13th to 18th centuries, including Renaissance masters.
detail_description: The Pinacoteca Tosio Martinengo is a small museum located in a historic sixteenth-century building, showcasing an impressive collection of paintings and applied art objects from the 13th to 18th centuries. The exhibition features works by renowned Renaissance masters such as Raphael, Vincenzo Foppa, Romanino, and Girolamo Savoldo. Visitors can also admire a sculpture by Canova and two monumental paintings by Francesco Hayez.
name: Pinacoteca Tosio Martinengo
address: Piazza Moretto, 4, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

excerpt: Brescia is a city in the northern Italian region of Lombardy. On the eastern outskirts is the San Salvatore–Santa Giulia complex. This former monastery includes a basilica, cloisters and the Santa Giulia Museum, with items including Roman bronzes and medieval frescoes. On Cidneo Hill, Brescia Castle has a drawbridge and ramparts, plus the Luigi Marzoli Arms Museum, exhibiting ancient weapons and armor.
detail_description: Brescia, located in the Lombardy region of northern Italy, offers a blend of historical and cultural attractions. The San Salvatore–Santa Giulia complex on the city's eastern outskirts features a former monastery with a basilica, cloisters, and the Santa Giulia Museum showcasing Roman bronzes and medieval frescoes. Overlooking the city from Cidneo Hill is Brescia Castle, housing the Luigi Marzoli Arms Museum displaying ancient weapons and armor.
name: Brescia
address: Province of Brescia, Italy

detail_description: Piazza della Loggia is a Renaissance square in Brescia, Italy, known for its historical and architectural significance. The area features well-preserved Roman public buildings, including the medieval castle and the Old and New cathedrals. It is part of a UNESCO World Heritage Site as one of seven Longobards in Italy, Places of Power. Brescia is also recognized as an important industrial city with economic significance in metallurgy, machine tools, firearms, mechanical engineering, and automotive engineering.
name: Piazza della Loggia
address: 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Nestled south of the Duomo on the bustling Corso Zanardelli, Teatro Grande is an 18th-century treasure that captivates visitors with its rich cultural offerings. This stunning venue hosts a variety of performances, including concerts, ballet, opera, and drama throughout the year. The auditorium itself is a sight to behold, featuring a deep-coffered ceiling adorned with gold accents and plush red boxes that create an opulent atmosphere.
name: Teatro Grande
address: Corso Giuseppe Zanardelli, 9/A, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

excerpt: City museum in Lombard Benedictine monastery complex, including artefacts from the region's history.
detail_description: The Santa Giulia Museum is a significant part of Brescia's rich historical and cultural heritage. Housed within a Lombard Benedictine monastery complex, the museum spans over 14 thousand square meters and showcases 12 thousand artifacts, offering a journey through Brescia's history from prehistory to the 19th century. The collection includes Coenoman Gaul artifacts, Roman statues, mosaics, frescoes, jewelry, and sacred objects.
name: Santa Giulia Museum
address: Via dei Musei, 81 b, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

excerpt: Romanesque 12th-century cathedral known for its circular shape & medieval frescoes, plus a crypt.
detail_description: The Duomo Vecchio, also known as the Old Cathedral, is a 12th-century Romanesque cathedral located in Brescia, Italy. It is renowned for its unique circular shape and medieval frescoes, as well as its crypt which dates back to the 8th century. The cathedral houses various works of art including paintings by Moretto and Romanino, a sepulcher by Bonino da Campione, and the great sepulchral ark of Berardo Maggi.
name: Duomo Vecchio
address: P.za Paolo VI, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Piazza della Vittoria is a Renaissance square in Brescia, Italy, known for its historical significance and architectural beauty. The city's old town features well-preserved Roman public buildings and monuments such as the medieval castle, the Old and New cathedral, and the Piazza della Loggia. Additionally, Brescia is recognized as an important industrial city with economic significance in metallurgy, machine tools, firearms, mechanical engineering, and automotive engineering.
name: Piazza della Vittoria
address: Brescia BS, Italy

excerpt: Italy’s Mille Miglia race is the focus at this museum with vintage race cars in a former monastery.
detail_description: The Museo Mille Miglia is a must-visit for car enthusiasts and history buffs alike. Located in the former Monastery of Sant'Eufemia, just 4km from Brescia's city center, this museum showcases a remarkable collection of vintage race cars that participated in the iconic Mille Miglia race between 1927 and 1957.
name: Museo Mille Miglia
address: Viale della Bornata, 123, 25135 Sant'Eufemia della Fonte BS, Italy

excerpt: Renaissance square surrounded by Venetian-style buildings, including the Palazzo della Loggia.
detail_description: Palazzo della Loggia is a Renaissance square in Brescia, surrounded by Venetian-style buildings. The city also boasts a dominating castle, old and new cathedrals, and beautiful squares like Piazza Vittoria and Piazza Paolo VI. Visitors come to admire the resourcefulness indicative of modern Brescian genius loci. Nearby attractions include Cinefotoclub - Museo Nazionale della Fotografia and Chiesa di San Giorgio.
name: Palazzo della Loggia
address: Piazza della Loggia, 1, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

excerpt: Remains of a Roman temple dating from 73 AD, with rebuilt chambers & preserved marble floors.
detail_description: Capitolium or Tempio Capitolino is a Roman temple dating back to 73 AD, dedicated to Jupiter, Juno, and Minerva. Perched on a hillside with two stairways leading to it, the temple's six Corinthian columns still stand today. The original white marble parts contrast with 19th-century brick restorations. The three chambers of the temple remain intact, showcasing original altars and colored marble floors.
name: Capitolium o Tempio Capitolino
address: Via dei Musei, 55, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

excerpt: Medieval castle with battlements, a tower, drawbridge & ramparts, plus an arms museum in the keep.
detail_description: Castello di Brescia, also known as Falcone d'Italia, is a medieval fortress located on Cidneo Hill in Brescia. The castle offers stunning views of the city and boasts a well-preserved defensive system that showcases the evolution of Italian military techniques. Visitors can explore the documented history of the fortress while strolling through its gardens and visiting museums housing historical relics, weaponry, and armory. The complex occupies a vast area and is one of Italy's largest fortifications.
name: Castello di Brescia
address: Via del Castello, 9, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

excerpt: Underground archaeological museum with art exhibits in an elegant palazzo decorated with frescoes.
detail_description: Palazzo Martinengo Cesaresco Novarino, located in Brescia, Italy, is a historic Renaissance building that has witnessed various historical events and transformations. Once the residence of the Martinengo family and later serving as the Brescia Police Headquarters, it now houses art exhibitions and an underground archaeological route. The palazzo boasts an elegant facade, classical architectural elements, and well-preserved interiors. It annually hosts exclusive temporary exhibitions featuring internationally renowned artists.
name: Palazzo Martinengo Cesaresco Novarino
address: Via dei Musei, 30, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: P.za del Foro is a must-visit square in Brescia, Italy. It serves as the gateway to the Archaeological Park and offers access to the city's glorious past. Surrounded by notable landmarks such as the Venetian-style Palazzo della Loggia, old and new cathedrals, and beautiful squares like Piazza Vittoria and Piazza Paolo VI, this area showcases the resourcefulness indicative of modern Brescian culture.
name: P.za del Foro
address: 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Palazzo Broletto, located in Piazza del Duomo, is the oldest center of power in the area. Its original core dates back to the 13th century and has been expanded several times over the centuries. The building is completed by the Torre del Popolo or Pegol, a 12th-century civic tower. It showcases a mix of Brescia's historical traditions from the Roman era to Venetian domination.
name: Palazzo Broletto
address: Via Cardinal Querini, 9, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Piazza della Vittoria is a charming square located in Brescia, Italy, known for its historical and architectural significance. The square is home to the impressive Palazzo della Loggia, a Renaissance-style palace that currently serves as the seat of the city's Municipal Council. The construction of this grand palace was initiated in 1484 as a symbol of good governance and has since become an iconic landmark in the area.
name: Piazza della Vittoria
address: Brescia BS, Italy

excerpt: Heart of Brescia's historic center, surrounded by Renaissance buildings & a 1500s clocktower.
detail_description: Piazza della Loggia is located in the heart of Brescia's historic center and is surrounded by impressive Renaissance buildings, including a 1500s clocktower. The square features buildings that once housed the prisons of Monte Vecchio di Pieta and Monte Nuovo di Pieta, with an austere curtain in white marble and ancient Roman tombstones incorporated into the masonry. Adjacent to the square is the beautiful Piazza Loggia, known for a tragic terrorist attack in 1974.
name: Piazza della Loggia
address: 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: The Roman Theatre of Brescia, also known as Brixia, has a rich history dating back to the Gauls. The Capitolium Archaeological Area, located in modern-day Piazza del Foro, was an important temple dedicated to the Capitoline Triad and was built by Emperor Vespasian. Although the theater itself is mostly ruins, it is still a fascinating place to explore with free entry and informative reader boards.
name: Roman Theatre of Brescia
address: Via dei Musei, 55, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Brescia, the National Museum of Photography - Cinefotoclub Brescia is a treasure trove for photography and cinema enthusiasts. Established in 1953, this museum boasts an impressive collection that spans from 1826 to the digital era, featuring over 8,000 artifacts that narrate the evolution of visual storytelling. Visitors can explore a vast archive containing more than 60,000 photographs—ranging from glass plates and negatives to prints and slides.
name: National Museum of Photography - Cinefotoclub Brescia
address: Contrada del Carmine, 2F, 25122 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Parco Archeologico di Brixia Romana offers a captivating journey through the remarkably well-preserved Roman ruins of ancient Brixia, known today as Brescia. The Santuario Repubblicano, dating back to the first century BC, boasts exquisitely adorned walls and is home to impeccably conserved wall paintings - a rare example of Republican Roman painting in northern Italy.
name: Parco archeologico di Brixia romana
address: Via dei Musei, 55, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Brescia, a hidden gem in the Lombardy region of northern Italy, offers a variety of attractions for visitors. The city is known for its underground rivers, where guided tours showcase the streams and tunnels beneath the town. For those seeking adventure, there's an option to explore the underground architecture on a longer tour.
name: Brescia
address: Viale della Stazione, 36, 25122 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Piazza del Foro is a historic square in Brescia, Italy, where numerous palaces are located, including Palazzo Martinengo and Palazzo Maggi Gambara. This area was once the bustling forum of the ancient Roman city of Brixia, with remnants that provide a glimpse into its grandeur. Standing on what used to be the Decumanus Maximus, now Via dei Musei, visitors can envision the classic buildings and original pavement with excavated shop fronts from centuries ago.
name: Piazza del Foro
address: 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Clock Tower, also known as Torre dell'Orologio, is a stunning landmark located in Brescia's Piazza della Loggia. Constructed between 1540 and 1550 by local architect Lodovico Beretta, this sixteenth-century tower features a complex mechanical clock installed by Paolo Gennari. The tower stands out on the east side of the square and boasts statues of two men that ring the bell to mark the hours.
name: Clock Tower
address: Piazza della Loggia, 10, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Duomo Nuovo, or the New Cathedral, is a striking contrast to its neighboring old cathedral. This opulent religious structure boasts rich decorations and a construction history spanning nearly 200 years. The Late Baroque architectural style is evident in the front facade's white stone and marble, adorned with numerous columns and a decorative pediment. Despite being initiated in 1604, the cathedral was not completed until 1825 due to repeated alterations over the centuries resulting in an eclectic mix of styles.
name: Duomo Nuovo
address: P.za Paolo VI, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: The restaurant Osteria del Savio, located in the town center, may be a challenge to locate but is definitely worth seeking out. It offers authentic Italian cuisine in a charming ambiance and is renowned for its signature dishes like the exceptional risotto. While it operates for dinner every day except Mondays, it also serves lunch on weekends. Additionally, this establishment presents a variety of delectable options such as hamburgers, polenta, and fried sage leaves that can now be recreated at home.
name: Osteria del Savio
address: Via Giovanni Piamarta, 1a, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Trattoria Urbana Mangiafuoco is a family-owned restaurant in northern Italy that offers traditional cuisine using locally sourced ingredients. They specialize in homemade cheese and meat from their own cattle farm. The menu features dishes such as chianina sirloin with a delightful sauce made of balsamic vinegar and honey. This charming eatery is open daily, except for Mondays and Sunday nights. Guests can enjoy an excellent dining experience with a great selection of wines, cheeses, and meats.
name: Trattoria Urbana "Mangiafuoco"
address: Via Calzavellia, 3A, 25122 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Corso Giuseppe Zanardelli is home to the Teatro Grande, a remarkable architectural gem in Brescia. The theater, located beneath the arcades of Corso Zanardelli, boasts a grand entrance accessed via a hidden staircase. Built on the site of Brescia's first public theater from 1664, the interior of Teatro Grande resembles Milan's La Scala.
name: Corso Giuseppe Zanardelli
address: 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Torre della Pallata is a medieval tower in Brescia, standing at 32m high and built in 1254 as an additional fortification. This stone structure has served as a clock tower and treasury over the years. With its characteristic crenulations and ornate clock-face, it adds character to the center of Brescia. The tower was also used to protect the gate of San Giovanni and store municipal goods.
name: Torre della Pallata
address: Via della Pace, 25122 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Piazza Paolo VI, also known as Piazza Duomo, is a captivating showcase of medieval architecture and the religious center of the city. It features two cathedrals: the neoclassical Duomo Nuovo and the 12th-century Duomo Vecchio, also called La Rotonda, a rare circular medieval stone building.
name: Piazza Paolo VI (già Piazza Duomo)
address: 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Monte Maddalena, also known as the mountain of the people of Brescia, offers a fantastic panoramic view just a short distance from the city. It's a popular spot for cyclists with benches along the road for breaks. The ascent from Nave provides a magnificent landscape, although the road is described as strange and full of potholes. Visitors can enjoy cleaner and fresher air while taking in splendid views of Brescia from above.
name: Monte Maddalena
address: 25075 Nave, Province of Brescia, Italy

detail_description: As you stroll up Cidneo Hill, keep your eyes peeled for the stunning silhouette of Duomo Nuovo peeking through the lush greenery. This magnificent dome is a true highlight of the city, offering a picturesque view that captures both its grandeur and charm. The sight of this architectural marvel amidst nature creates an unforgettable experience for any traveler exploring the area.
name: Duomo Nuovo
address: P.za Paolo VI, 5, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: P.za Paolo VI is a charming medieval square located in the center of Brescia. It is dominated by two impressive cathedrals, the Summer Cathedral of Santa Maria Assunta and the Winter Cathedral of Santa Maria Assunta. The square also features the Palazzo del Broletto, which boasts a stone tower dating back to the 13th century.
name: P.za Paolo VI
address: 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Cimitero Vantiniano in Brescia is a must-visit for those interested in unique and monumental cemeteries. It's a popular spot for cemetery enthusiasts, like blogger Claudia, who enjoy exploring these distinctive sites.
name: Via Milano
address: 25126 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Biblioteca Queriniana in Brescia is a hidden gem, featuring beautiful rooms for consulting old books under supervision, a general reading room, and two picturesque rooms filled with numerous books. The library offers a great environment for studying or working, but visitors are required to leave their bags in lockers at the entrance. The building was constructed between 1746 and 1749 by Bishop Angelo Maria Querini and houses approximately 1500 volumes from his private collection.
name: Biblioteca Queriniana, Brescia
address: Via Mazzini, 1, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

name: Bresciaunderground Aps
address: Cascina Aurora, Via Raffaello Sanzio, 165, 25134 San Polo BS, Italy

detail_description: The Winter Cathedral of Santa Maria Assunta, also called the Old Cathedral or La Rotonda due to its circular design, is a Romanesque church situated in Brescia. It is located close to Duomo Nuovo (New Cathedral) at Piazza Paolo VI. Initially, the Old Cathedral was built after demolishing the early Christian structure of Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore de Dom that existed since the 7th century.
name: Cathedral of Santa Maria Assunta
address: P.za Paolo VI, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

name: Parrocchia della Cattedrale Brescia
address: Via dei Musei, 43, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: The Church of St. Francis of Assisi, located in Brescia on the street bearing the same name, is a historic site dedicated to Saint Francis. The church dates back to the 13th and 14th centuries and is accompanied by an ancient Franciscan convent. Although completed in 1265, its frescoes were added in the early 14th century.
name: Chiesa di San Francesco d`Assisi
address: Via San Francesco D`Assisi, 1, 25122 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Housed within the ancient Mastio Visconteo, the Luigi Marzoli Museum of Weapons is a fascinating display of Brescia's rich weaponry tradition. Inaugurated in 1988, this museum showcases over 700 pieces of various types of weapons, including white arms, defensive gear, firearms, and artillery. The collection spans from the fifteenth to the early nineteenth century and highlights the technological and artistic advancements achieved by local craftsmen during that time.
name: Luigi Marzoli Museum of Weapons
address: Via del Castello, 9, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

name: ACQUASPLASH FRANCIACORTA
address: Via Generale dalla Chiesa, 75, 25040 Corte Franca BS, Italy

detail_description: The Diocesan Museum of Brescia is an art museum in Italy that showcases the artistic heritage of the Diocese of Brescia. This specialty museum is situated in the greater cloister of Saint Joseph's Monastery, near Piazza della Loggia. The museum is owned by the Catholic church and located beside Saint Giorgio Church in downtown Brescia. This small yet exceptional museum boasts exhibits on medieval culture and fine arts, making it a must-see destination for art enthusiasts visiting the city.
name: Diocesan Museum of Brescia
address: Via Gasparo da Salò, 13, 25122 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Brescia, the Santuario di Santa Maria delle Grazie is a stunning example of late Mannerism transitioning into Baroque architecture. This remarkable sanctuary features an abundance of intricate stucco work and gilding that captivates visitors. The only original element remaining is its striking 14th-century façade, which adds to its historical charm.
name: Santuario di Santa Maria delle Grazie
address: Via delle Grazie, 13, 25122 Brescia BS, Italy

excerpt: This 15th-century Renaissance Roman Catholic church features frescoes & a Moretto painting.
detail_description: Saint Maria of Miracles, a 15th-century Renaissance Roman Catholic church in Brescia, is a masterpiece of art and sculpture. The facade, built in 1488 to honor the miraculous image of the Madonna and Child, is adorned with Botticino stone and finely decorated with sculptures depicting sacred and profane motifs. The church also houses statues by Calegari. Additionally, it features frescoes and a Moretto painting.
name: Saint Maria of Miracles
address: Corso Martiri della Libertà, 25122 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: In Brescia, the church of Santi Nazaro e Celso is a must-visit for art and history enthusiasts. This magnificent building, reconstructed in the 18th century, houses a rich collection of masterpieces including altarpieces by renowned artists such as Romano and Pittoni. One of its highlights is an early work by Tiziano Vecellio, displayed in the apse - a famous 16th-century altarpiece depicting the Martyrdom of St.
name: Santi Nazaro e Celso, Brescia
address: Corso Giacomo Matteotti, 31, 25122 Brescia BS, Italy

excerpt: Programme of dance, ballet, concerts & opera in a large capacity theater with a seafood bistro.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of the city, Gran Teatro Morato stands as a vibrant hub for cultural experiences, hosting an array of performances including dance, ballet, concerts, and opera. This spacious venue not only boasts excellent acoustics and comfortable seating but also features a delightful seafood bistro for pre-show dining. Visitors rave about its cleanliness and inviting atmosphere.
name: Gran Teatro Morato
address: Via S. Zeno, 168, 25124 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Palazzo Vescovile is a remarkable historical site, rich in culture and art. It serves as a hub for diverse initiatives, fostering dialogue and exchange of ideas, not limited to religious matters. The Bishop's hospitality was exceptional, enhancing the overall experience. This beautiful ancient building stands proudly in the center of Brescia, showcasing its historical grandeur and significance.
name: Palazzo Vescovile
address: Piazzetta Vescovado, ., 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Explore the Chiesa di San Faustino in Riposo, a cherished religious site nestled within the historic city walls of Brescia. This petite Catholic church is adored by locals and holds a somewhat concealed position. It is regarded as a stunning hidden treasure within Brescia, evoking gratitude towards its divine presence.
name: Little Church of Saint Faustino in Riposo
address: Via dei Musei, 16, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

name: Mario Rigamonti Stadium
address: Via Giovanni Novagani, 9, 25133 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: Chiesa di San Giuseppe is a 14th-century church located in the medieval neighborhood of Brescia. The facade, a rare example of Renaissance urban spaces, is nestled between tall medieval houses and crowned by Gothic-inspired terracotta pinnacles. Inside, visitors can find the tomb of Benedetto Marcello and Antegnati, known as the "Stradivari" of organs.
name: Chiesa di San Giuseppe
address: Vicolo S. Giuseppe, 5, 25122 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: The AMBIENTEPARCO is a captivating and engaging park, specifically designed to cater to the needs of children. It offers an array of diverse amenities and facilities that are accessible to all visitors. This park stands out as one of the most stunning recreational areas in Brescia, providing an ideal environment for both learning and leisure activities. With its innovative approach, AMBIENTEPARCO aims to educate through interactive courses in science and other subjects.
name: AMBIENTEPARCO - science park with educational courses
address: Largo Torrelunga, 7, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy

detail_description: The Church of San Zeno al Foro is a Catholic church located in Brescia, Italy. Situated in Piazza del Foro, near the Capitolium, this historic church was dedicated to San Zeno, the eighth bishop of Verona during the latter part of the 4th century. Constructed during the Middle Ages, it has a charming facade with Baroque-style elements. Inside, there is a single nave adorned with canvas paintings and wooden artworks.
name: San Zeno al Foro, Brescia
address: P.za del Foro, 25121 Brescia BS, Italy
